page.title: 04Sheep and Cattle Farming
page.content: Where possible the farmers choose to grow crops but certain areas are unsuitable and it is unprofitable to use the land in this way.These areas are the more hilly regions where the soils are not good enough to support the growth of commercial-type crops and the valley floor areas which are too wet and boggy to be used for crop production. They are therefore turned over to sheep and cattle farming, the former on the hilly slopes and craggy outcrops and the latter in the low lying but unproductive valley floors. There is little or no dairy farming in the area. The cattle are reared for beef and stock. They are fed on silage and haylage produced on the farms. There is little other livestock reared on the farms although most farms have free range hens and some rear horses for racing, showing and riding.
